author: k9wazere

text:
1) Sonic the Hedgehog 2. Obviously!!!
2) For the 2D Games it will be always Green Hill Zone. For the 3D Games maybe the theme from Sonic 06.
3) Not any in special.
4) Sonic all the way!!
author: Ater Albus

text:
1) Sonic 3 & Kuckles (such a big, complete, deep game! Awesome levels, lots of secrets that encourage exploration, unlike the fairly straightforward level design of most subsequent titles, varied gameplay with different characters, bonus stages, items, etc. I love the chaos stages, and it even manages to tell a really interesting story without a single letter of dialogue! One of my favorite games of all time) 
2)  2D - So hard to choose! But i guess Sky Sanctuary (Sonic&Knuckles). Also this one. I remember how beautiful Green Hill Zone looks when you had only ever played NES games before! 
      3D - Green Forest (Sonic Adventure 2) 
3) So many with Sonic3 &Knuckles! I played it alot when my two brothers and two cousins were watching, and we had a blast discovering all the secrets.. i remember being amazed about the Super Emeralds, and the discover of Super Tails (since he gets nothing for the Chaos Emeralds) Also realizing how much different Sonic's endgame is from Knuckles (who i always played until i beat it with him) Also playing the hundreds of optional chaos stages! 
4) I always was a huge Knuckles fan. He's still my favorite, but i don't like what they've done to him in the 3D games etc. Especially Sonic Boom where they made him a bulky meathead.

text: 1) Sonic Adventure for the Dreamcast2) 2D games: Chemical Plant Zone, 3D games: Azure Blue World3) Not really4) Tails

text:
1) Sonic the Hedgehog 3 - with Sonic and Knuckles add-on
2) Probably Zone 13 in the Death Egg, preferably act 2. If not it's Zone 10 in the Lava Reef.
3) Completing every file in order with Sonic and Tails, Sonic solo, Tails solo, and then knuckles. You could do each game play twice before each save file was filled. And then, one day I flipped it on and it was all erased. So lame.
4) I prefer Tails because of the flying, and you are a lot smaller playing as Tails.

text:
Well i began with Sonic 1 and 2 (I had the two games at the same time), and for me the best is still by far Sonic3&Knuckles. Everything is so much better, so much crazier, this game was the climax of the Sonic saga.
Btw, just a detail but in Sonic 2 it's super sonic, hyper sonic was only in S3&K (and still is as far as i know).
author: xenotypos

text:
Knuckles will always be my fav. In Sonic 3, he seemed to be the "rebellious" one while Tales was soft and laid back. Sonic just liked his chilli dogs lol

I do like the Dreamcast Sonic Adventures 1. It was fun. To me they made sonic cool but after Sonic Adventures......................the entire series went to shit
author: The Destati

text:
Sonic 2 was actually the first sonic game I played. So it's always be my favorite. Plus it has the best Soundtrack IMO.

Memorable moments? Just about everything of Sonic 2 LOL! I probably beaten that game at least 7x...got all the emeralds remember those stages get REALLY tough especially for single players. Tales always ruined those stages since he always got hit...

Hypersonic was a blast! The Metropolis Cave and that plant zone (3 long stages) but the music was fantastic! Pumped me up!!!
author: The Destati

text:
1.Favorite Sonic game?
-I'm still have yet to beat Sonic Colors. So until then, SA2:Battle will be my favorite.
2. Favorite song?
-Ooooh, dat Sonic Rush soundtrack...so hard to choose...I'm gonna have to say it's a tie between Wrapped in Black/Raisin' Me.
3. Memories/stories related to Sonic?
-I remember when my older brother when we were little drew Sonic crying & walking down a stairwell. I was so blown by it, he got me drawing. It made me the artist I am today.
4. Favorite?
C'mon, Sonic!

But then he moved and took the system with him, and I hadn't beat it. I didn't get a chance to do so until Sonic Gems Collection came out.
4. Sonic!

text:
1. Sonic the Hedgehog 3 and Knuckles.

2. Ice Cap Zone for 2D games, Emerald Coast for 3D games.

3. I still remember seeing Sonic Adventure for the first time playing on a TV at the mall. The N64 had been out for a while, and that was nice, but this was the first time 3D graphics looked really slick. And  think the game still looks great. Of course Sega's shot the series to Hell, but back then it looked fantastic.

4. Tails. You can't beat flying.
author: jdng86

text:
1. Sonic The Hedgehog 3 and Knuckles
2. Mad Gear Zone Act 3 (Sonic the Hedgehog 4 Episode 1[ PSN Version ])
3. Back then I was the first one in my neighborhood to have the Sonic and Knuckles pack, and I would ALWAYS leave Sonic 3 in it. One day though, a kid brought Sonic the Hedgehog and he put it on, (I got my Genesis from my uncle and he gave me Sonic 2) that is when I found out of Blue spheres mode. A lot of games were addicted to that, it was like the Tetris madness.
author: Zay S

text: Answer to number 3: chao world enough said
author: Nicholas Quevedo

text:
1. Sonic the Hedgehog 2 would be my favorite, since it's the only one I've played.

2. I don't really know many of the songs, so I'd have to go with Green Hill Zone. Perhaps I should check out the rest.

3. I also only had Nintendo consoles growing up. The only chance I had to play the game was in the waiting room for the hairdressers I often went to as a kid - they had a Sega Genesis hooked up with a small TV. StH2 is the only game I remember playing there.

4. Sonic.
author: Clown Crusade

text:
1. Sonic 3 & Knuckles (Don't like the 3D games)
2. For 2D : Tied between Sonic 1- Dr. Robotnik's Theme (Boss) and Sonic & Knuckles- Lava Reef Zone Act I
For 3D: Sonic the Hedgehog (2006) - Solaris Phase 2
3. Joining a crowd of older kids at my daycare watching and cheering for the kid playing Sonic & Knuckles. Everyone ended up getting stuck at Sandopolis Act II.
4. Sorry Sonic but Knuckles is mah boy! ^^
author: LordxxAxelxxLover

text: My favorite game is part 1. Love Sonic out of all the characters and the first stage music is something I loved since the first time I played Sonic on of all platforms, Game Gear. Laying in bed as a kid playing that level is a sentimental thing for sure.
author: DTMTroy

text:
1. Sonic 3 & Knuckles

2. Sonic 1: Star Light Zone
Sonic 2: Don't have a strong favorite from this game.
Sonic 3 & Knuckles: Lot of good favorites here, but most notably Ice Cap Zone and Death Egg Zone.

3. That damn barrel in Carnival Night Zone Act 2. On another note, I actually tried getting Knuckles into areas only available to Sonic and Tails and succeeded. I even got to the Carnival Night Zone boss with Knuckles.

4. Um... Sonic?
author: FMFlameNinja

text: Sonic & knucles first stage
author: lvaro Jimnez

text: Mystic cave from 2! and ice Cap zone from 3!
author: 2012Ascenscion

text:
1. For 2D, it's either Sonic 2 or Sonic 4: Episode 1. For 3D, it has to be Sonic Unleashed (XBox360/PS3 version).
2. Where to start...there's too many! XD Either Star Light Zone from Sonic 1 or Hydrocity Zone Act 2 from Sonic 3 for 2D, and either His World from Sonic 06 or Endless Possibility from Sonic Unleashed for 3D.
3. Beating the final boss on Sonic 2 as a 3 year old, but NOT being able to beat it as a 10 year old.
4. Sonic and Tails equally. Never liked Knuckles that much.
author: SamuraiSonic

text:
1.) Sonic 2, yeah.  Can't get much better.  For 3D, Sonic Adventure 2: Battle.
2.) Ooh, there's a lot.  Aquatic Ruin, Flying Battery Zone act 2, the first Frozen Mountain act from the first GBA Sonic, Metal Harbor from SA2:B.
3.) Nostalgia for me is playing Sonic Spinball.  Used to go over my cousins and face him at that a lot when we were kixds.
4.) Knuckles.  Sonic has grown wearing on me over the years, and I never really liked Tails.
author: Honatuto

text:
1. Sonic 2 fer sure, then Sonic & Knuckles

2. Sky Chase zone and Hill Top zone

3. First time ever seeing Super Sonic... EPIC.

4. Growing up as a Genesis boy I went through phases liking each, but you gotta go with Sonic.
author: phatboy5454

text:
1. Sonic The Hedgehog 2 for 2D games, Sonic Adventure 2 for 3D games

2. City Escape

3. The Chao garden from Sonic Adventure 2. Me and my friends wasted hours there

4. Sonic
author: WarningSDE

text:
You know, I never appreciated how great this song is until I was listening to random game music and happened upon Sunset Hill Zone from Sonic Advanced 3. x3
1. Sonic 2, SA2B, and Sonic 3 + Knuckles
2. Toughie! Mystic Cave, Hang Castle, or Mystic Mansion. Chemical Plant is good too.
3. I'm great at Mystic Cave 'cause I used to beat my friends at it. XD Also, Mean Bean Machine vs was always intense~
Not to mention raising all of my chao~ I'm a sucker for that kind of thing. x3
4. KNUCKLES! :3
author: Sayeth Di Puppeth

text: Holy sht you went back with this one..I never owned a Sega but my cousin, who's getting married next weekend, had one that I played! Good song and way to hit 800!

text:
1. Sonic 2
2. 2D - Spring Yard Zone, 3D - City Escape lol
3. As much as I loved the 2D games, my favorite memory has to be getting a dreamcast and the first sonic adventure.
4. Sonic
author: CelsoKelso

text:
1. 3 & Knuckles
2. Hydrocity Zone Act 2
3. Getting Super Sonic for the first time in 2, playing Green Hill Zone for the first time as well.
4. Sonic, followed by Tails, followed by Knuckles.
author: Saga Saga

text:
1. Sonic 2. That was the peak of Sonic games for me.

2. For the 2D games, probably Marble Zone. For the 3D games, it's easily any of the Shamar Hub themes.

3. I don't really have much memories of Sonic. I never really owned a Sega console.

4. All three. The new Sonic characters just don't compare to them.
author: NukeA6

text:
1. Sonic 3 & knuckles
2. Spring Yard Zone from Sonic 1
3. Playing Sonic 3 & knuckles with my cousins. One of them spilled orange juice on my Genesis xD
3. Knuckles all the way. After I grew out o my sonic obsession Knuckles suddenly seemed cooler.

text: Who do I prefer? Eggman of course!

author: Brookie Smallz

text:
1. Sonic Adventure
2. E-102 Gamma's theme
3. Waking up on almost every summer day with the Gamecube at my feet and the remote in my hand. Just had to press the power button then the T.V and I was in a world of Sonic Adventures for the rest of the day, until I got tired again, in which case I just layed down and fell asleep again lol

text:
1. Sonic the Hedgehog
2. Starlight Zone
3. Too many to put here. lol
4. While I love all three of them, you just HAVE to pick Sonic.

author: Koopsas

text:
A very good choice for #800. I really wondered what it is going to be.
I would like to answer these questions,but sadly I only played one sonic game,and it was before many years.
But then if I would answer it would be: 
1. Sonic the Hedghog 2(the one I remember)
2.Can't really remember the music,so it would be this one
3.the nostalogic moment when I first saw the game. I was back there really interested in it,and while I though that it is a little different,I enjoyed it.
4.Sonic I think
author: LightFykki

text: If it's one positive thing everyone can generally agree upon, its' that even the modern Sonic games have excellent music.
author: rannum

text: Sonic & Knuckles is my fav.  Sonic 2 a close second.
author: Zell Carter

text: @wakaccount Tails is a "he".
author: Thomas Maas

text:
1) Sonic 3 and Knuckles.
2) Starlight Zone. Seriously, I'll have that as my wedding song.
3) Showing off to my friends how easily I could beat Sonic 2's Death Egg. They were so impressed! 
4) Knuckles! He was my favorite growing up. I suppose he still is.
author: GD2kplus

text:
1) Sonic the Hedgehog 2
2) 2D: Icecap Zone Act 1; 3D: Unawakening Float
3) When Sonic CD came out, I was in awe. It was the first game I played with FMV and vocal songs. It had some of the coolest gameplay mechanics in a game that I've seen and would like to see again. I mean, playing with the time stream was awesome.
4) Sonic of course.
author: StakeJade

text:
1 Sonic 3 and Knuckles

2. Green Hill and Sky Sanctuary are my all time favorites

3. My first console was a sega genesis, so I spent a great deal of my childhood playing the sonic games, including some pretty great moments like figuring out how to get past that god damn barrel in carnival night and beating doomsday zone for the first time

4. All of them for different reasons, ,when I was younger I preferred tails so that I could just fly over obstacles
author: burbboy27

text:
1 - SA2B
2 - 2D: Chemical Plant Zone 3D: Escape the City
3 - Yes, so nostalgic!
4 - Knucles
author: Minister

text:
1) Close tie between S3&K and Sonic Adventure.

2) It constantly varies. But at the moment, Cosmic Wall (SA2) and Sky Deck a Go Go (SA1).

3) Finally beating the final boss of Sonic 2 after always failing when I was a child. SWEET VICTORY.

4) Knuckles. Hidden paths, climbing walls, gliding...and an awesome character design in general.  A shame that the later 3D games flanderized him as an easily-tricked moron. :(
author: JonathonRedley

text:
1- The one that I played the most: Sonic The Hedgehog 2.

2- Sky Sanctuary. It always cheers me up.

3- I lived in my mother house where I had a SNES but when I went to my father house I played on my Sega Mega Drive. I can't forget the joy of having Sonic, Sonic 2 and Sonic 3 to play there. Sonic was a really important part of my childhood. 

4- Tails. I like Foxes and she is a mechanical. SHE ALSO CAN FLY!
author: Waka Laka

text: I have no answers for any of the questions. Just... dayumn! It only took six months to upload 100 more!! I remember not that long ago, watching and commenting on the entry #700.
author: Nathan Blair

text:
#1. Gotta be the original, Sonic The Hedgehog 1. I never played much of any others.
#2. My favorite song is definitely Green Hill Zone- nostalgia supreme.
#3. Sonic was my childhood hero, my and my cousin used to pretend to be the characters in the games and reenact the cartoons. Nobody ever had the systems to play, but I knew the character well.
#4. I was always Knuckles lol. But I like both him and Sonic! I gotta choose Sonic though, I just like his style.
author: ShadowKinesis

text:
#1: Sonic Unleashed, that game brinks on the edge of perfection, I play that everyday, the retro games, maybe once in a few months.....

#2: Mission Street, Jun Senoue, I love that man.

#3: Wanting a Dreamcast for Sonic Adventure 1, what a fool I was....

#4: Tails....just...just..Tails....

author: erede007

text:
1. Sonic 3+K, although Sonic 2 has to come up at a close second.
2. Probably a tie between the Final Boss theme from Sonic 3+K and Hidden Palace.
3. The Sega Genesis was the first system I ever saved up money to buy, at over 100 dollars (and this was when I was like, 6 or so, so I saved up a lot). It came bundled with Sonic 2, so that ended up being my first Sonic game as well.
4. Tails.
author: FoxMan

text:
1-Sonic 3 and Knuckles
2-The Doomsday Zone
3-I often rented a Sega Genesis at the local video store and played all the genesis Sonic games. I was always a Nintendo fanboy at heart so eventually, I sopped caring about Sonic. Then Sega went third party. The first Sonic game I actually bought was Sonic Advance. The first time I played that game, it was like making up with a friend you've been fighting with for years.
4-I've always liked Tails
Also, I hear Sonic Colors is getting great reviews.
author: EvilMariobot

text: A true classic. no just VGM, but music as well. Surprised this wasnt on the list yet
author: Akerfeldtfan

text:
I got it right! It IS video game music!
1.) Sonic The Hedgehog 2(Sonic Adventure would be the winner if not for a certain Cat in that game).
2.) Easy. Wrapped In Black. I can't stop listening to it, well over 100 times in a row and finally added it to my own VGM list.
3.) Sonic's always been big for me. Specially since we're the same age! Me & Sonic in fact seem to share many momentous occasions...almost like I'm his human twin...not Chris.
4.) Knuckles(I must admit, also love Blaze).

text:

BTW the picture on the wall in Hidden Palace Zone will always be stuck in my head! 
4. Sonic, always was, always will be.
